skill.name: research-grants
skill.description: Write competitive research proposals for NSF, NIH, DOE, and DARPA. Agency-specific formatting, review criteria, budget preparation, broader impacts, significance statements, innovation narratives, and compliance with submission requirements.
skill.summary: Write competitive research proposals for NSF, NIH, DOE, and DARPA. Agency-specific formatting, revie...
skill.author: K-Dense Inc.

security_audit.summary: No credential access, environment harvesting, or execution code was found. Content is static guidance and templates with public informational links only.

content.value_statement: Grant rules differ across agencies and drafts often miss key criteria. This skill provides structured guidance and templates to build compliant, persuasive sections.
actual_capabilities: Provide NSF project summary structure with required headings
Provide NIH specific aims page template and checklist
Guide budget justification narratives with calculation examples
Summarize agency-specific criteria for NSF, NIH, DOE, and DARPA
Explain broader impacts planning and assessment guidance
limitations: Does not submit applications to agency portals
Does not create figures without the scientific-schematics skill
Does not provide legal or institutional compliance review
Requires user-provided project details and data

use_cases.title: Draft core proposal text
use_cases.description: Build project summary, research strategy, and broader impacts aligned to NSF or NIH review criteria.

use_cases.title: Refine specific aims
use_cases.description: Develop a clear aims page with hypotheses, approaches, and expected outcomes for NIH style proposals.

use_cases.title: Draft budget justification
use_cases.description: Create aligned personnel and equipment justifications with clear calculations and narrative rationale.

prompt_templates.title: Draft NSF summary
prompt_templates.scenario: You need a one page NSF Project Summary.
prompt_templates.prompt: Create an NSF Project Summary with Overview, Intellectual Merit, and Broader Impacts for a study on coastal wetland resilience. Include measurable impacts.

prompt_templates.title: NIH aims outline
prompt_templates.scenario: You need a first draft NIH Specific Aims page.
prompt_templates.prompt: Draft a NIH Specific Aims page for a project on precision subtyping of type 2 diabetes. Include 3 aims with hypotheses and expected outcomes.

prompt_templates.title: DOE narrative plan
prompt_templates.scenario: You need a DOE technical narrative outline.
prompt_templates.prompt: Outline a DOE project narrative for grid scale energy storage, including significance, technical approach, milestones, and team qualifications.

prompt_templates.title: Full budget rationale
prompt_templates.scenario: You need a detailed budget justification.
prompt_templates.prompt: Write a budget justification for a 3 year project with a PI, 1 postdoc, 2 PhD students, equipment, and travel. Include calculations and roles.

output_examples.input: Draft an NSF Project Summary for a study on wildfire risk modeling in the western United States.
output: Overview: Clear public facing summary of the wildfire risk problem and modeling approach
Intellectual Merit: New integration of satellite data and climate models with stated knowledge gaps
Broader Impacts: Outreach to land managers, student training plan, and public risk tools with metrics

best_practices: Provide agency name, program type, and page limits in the prompt
Include concrete metrics, timelines, and deliverables for impacts
State hypotheses and expected outcomes in each aim
anti_patterns: Asking for a generic proposal without agency context
Requesting submission or portal access actions
Using vague claims without measurable outcomes

faq.question: Is this compatible with NSF, NIH, DOE, and DARPA?
faq.answer: Yes. The guidance includes templates and criteria for these agencies, but you must verify program specific rules.

faq.question: What are the main limits of the skill?
faq.answer: It does not submit proposals, generate figures by itself, or validate institutional compliance requirements.

faq.question: Can I integrate this with my existing grant workflow?
faq.answer: Yes. Use the templates to draft sections, then paste into your institutional or agency forms.

faq.question: Does it access or store my data?
faq.answer: No. The skill content is static guidance and templates without data collection or external calls.

faq.question: What if the output feels too generic?
faq.answer: Provide more project specifics, sample size, methods, and goals. Then ask for revision with those details.

faq.question: How does this compare with a generic writing assistant?
faq.answer: It is tailored to grant structures, agency criteria, and section specific checklists rather than general writing advice.
